The Data Science Team in SGRNA is focused on various activities supporting various businesses of Saint-Gobain, especially in R&D and Manufacturing. Our R&D is looking for a highly motivated individual to help us uncover insights into material formulation using data informed analytics, in addition to supporting Industry 4.0 projects. During this temporary assignment, the candidate will work with various types of data (structured, unstructured, images), analyze the data and use advanced ML techniques to develop state of the art algorithms to identify relationships and drivers of data patterns, and present the findings in both written and oral formats. The candidate should enjoy learning new ML technologies, problem solving, and potentially designing innovative algorithms using modern and up to date ML and AI techniques alongside good coding practices (git). In addition to the candidate’s primary projects, the candidate will be expected to support projects led by others. The candidate should demonstrate an open and collaborative approach in all areas of responsibility and seek out others to enhance and streamline development and decision making. Capable of problem-solving and able to break down complex problems into actionable next steps, and able to achieve them within a reasonable timeline. Document experiments, procedures and results in clear and coherent technical reports and presentation. Possess a mindset for good coding practices, documentation of codes and learning cloud tools. WHO WE ARE: WHO WE ARE: Saint-Gobain Research (SGR) North America is one of Saint-Gobain’s largest industrial research laboratories. The center is home to more than 400 employees working at the leading edge of innovation on multidisciplinary industrial research, preparing the future by designing tomorrow's products and processes across an amazing variety of markets and technical disciplines. Since 1985, SGR North America has been supporting existing businesses, developing future businesses, and nurturing talent. Saint-Gobain designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions which are key ingredients in the wellbeing of each of us and the future of all. They can be found everywhere in our living places and our daily life: in buildings, transportation, infrastructure and in many industrial applications. They provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. About us: Who is Cintra? With US headquarters in Austin, Texas, Cintra is the leading private-sector transportation infrastructure company in the world, with experience spanning over 50 years of innovative highway development on four continents. Today, its portfolio includes nearly 1,200 miles of managed highways globally, representing a total global investment in roadway improvements of over $24.8 billion. Cintra manages over $10 billion of infrastructure projects in the United States and more than $4.7 billion of infrastructure projects in Canada. What makes us different? Our people come first. We want every single employee to develop both professionally and personally. With a strong focus on growth potential, we look to our internal employees as potential candidates for both national and international opportunities. We aim to achieve greatness by promoting from within every chance we get. We work hard and play hard and strive every day for success and achievement. With a diverse group of professionals working in a fast-paced environment, we achieve milestones constantly. And if that weren’t enough, we also offer our employees highly competitive insurance benefits, Paid Time Off, and a matching 401(k) program. Job Description: As a Data Scientist Trainee, you will have the opportunity to develop your data driven skills to optimize our current operations and develop analysis to increase our knowledge for new development. Additionally, you will utilize advanced analytics while working with the best in industry to optimize revenue and improve accuracy of Cintra and our concessions. Group 1001 is a consumer-centric, technology-driven family of insurance companies on a mission to deliver outstanding value and operational performance by combining financial strength and stability with deep insurance expertise and a can-do culture. Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. This goal extends to how we hire and onboard our most valuable assets – our employees. Company Overview: Gainbridge, a part of the Group 1001 enterprise, is a self-managed, innovative, digital platform providing its clients with direct access to trusted financial products to smartly grow their savings over time. Gainbridge strives to offer products through its platform that are simple, intuitive, and backed by smart technology with no complexity or hidden fees. Gainbridge empowers clients to take control of the financial future with simple solutions that are accessible to everyone no matter their budget. Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences. The Opportunity: We are seeking a talented and experienced Marketing-focused Data Scientist to join our dynamic team at Gainbridge. As the Data Scientist, Marketing, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven marketing strategies and initiatives to optimize our marketing efforts, enhance customer acquisition and retention, and maximize overall business performance. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineering, marketing, and product to leverage data and analytics to inform decision-making and drive marketing insights. What You’ll Do: Leverage data tools like Snowflake and SQL to build large datasets for analysis and use the data to make optimization recommendations on marketing spend. Lead the development and execution of marketing analytics strategies to drive customer acquisition, retention, and growth. Design and implement measurement frameworks, KPIs, and dashboards to track and analyze marketing performance across various channels and campaigns. Utilize advanced analytics techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights from marketing data, including customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis, attribution modeling, and campaign analysis. Collaborate with the marketing team to define and optimize marketing strategies based on data-driven insights, ensuring alignment with business objectives and target audience preferences. Conduct thorough analyses of marketing campaigns, including A/B testing, customer profiling, and conversion analysis, to identify opportunities for optimization and performance improvement. Develop predictive models and conduct forecasting to drive proactive marketing decision-making and campaign planning. Drive the implementation and utilization of marketing analytics tools and technologies to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to leverage customer data and insights for product development, user experience enhancements, and personalized marketing initiatives. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and advancements in marketing analytics, and provide recommendations for continuous improvement and innovation. About You: Requirements: SQL coding experience required. Strong expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization techniques. Proficiency in analytical tools such as Python or R is required. Proven experience (5+ years) in data science, marketing analytics or a similar role, preferably within the financial services, insurance or another highly-regulated industry. Understanding of customer lifetime value, and exposure to lifetime value modeling (LTV); understands how to optimize marketing to LTV. Experience with marketing analytics platforms and tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, etc.) is highly desirable. Solid understanding of marketing principles, digital marketing strategies, and customer acquisition/retention concepts. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations. Analytical, data-driven mindset with a curiosity to identify sales patterns from various marketing and sponsorship activities. Familiarity and ease with the fintech ecosystem, B2B technology applications and how technology platforms serve customer businesses. Nice to have: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. Soft skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders. Self-motivated and detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment. Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Nice to have: Interest in and experience with the insurance industry is a plus. Life at Group1001: Our culture: We are building the financial services company of the future that reflects the progressing world today; we believe that diversity in background and experiences will help us build a financial services company that attracts top talent in order to execute on our strategic priorities. We want to create a collaborative culture focused on our mission, making alternative financial services tools intuitive and accessible for all Americans. We want to build a driven culture of excellence so that our talent feels like they’re doing meaningful work. What we offer: Compensation: Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets. The total compensation for this position ranges from $140,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $200,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Benefits Highlights: Employees (and their families) are eligible to participate in the Company’s comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plan options. Employees are also eligible for Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance, Short and Long-Term Disability, and to enroll in the Company’s Employee Assistance Program and other wellness initiatives. Employees may also participate in the Company’s 401K plan, with matching contributions by the Company. Group 1001 is a consumer-centric, technology-driven family of insurance companies on a mission to deliver outstanding value and operational performance by combining financial strength and stability with deep insurance expertise and a can-do culture. Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. Company Overview: Gainbridge, a part of the Group 1001 enterprise, is a self-managed, innovative, digital platform providing its clients with direct access to trusted financial products to smartly grow their savings over time. Gainbridge strives to offer products through its platform that are simple, intuitive, and backed by smart technology with no complexity or hidden fees. Gainbridge empowers clients to take control of the financial future with simple solutions that are accessible to everyone no matter their budget. Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences. The Opportunity: We are seeking a talented and experienced Marketing-focused Data Scientist to join our dynamic team at Gainbridge. As the Data Scientist, Marketing, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven marketing strategies and initiatives to optimize our marketing efforts, enhance customer acquisition and retention, and maximize overall business performance. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineering, marketing, and product to leverage data and analytics to inform decision-making and drive marketing insights. What You’ll Do: Leverage data tools like Snowflake and SQL to build large datasets for analysis and use the data to make optimization recommendations on marketing spend. Lead the development and execution of marketing analytics strategies to drive customer acquisition, retention, and growth. Design and implement measurement frameworks, KPIs, and dashboards to track and analyze marketing performance across various channels and campaigns. Utilize advanced analytics techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights from marketing data, including customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis, attribution modeling, and campaign analysis. Collaborate with the marketing team to define and optimize marketing strategies based on data-driven insights, ensuring alignment with business objectives and target audience preferences. Conduct thorough analyses of marketing campaigns, including A/B testing, customer profiling, and conversion analysis, to identify opportunities for optimization and performance improvement. Develop predictive models and conduct forecasting to drive proactive marketing decision-making and campaign planning. Drive the implementation and utilization of marketing analytics tools and technologies to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to leverage customer data and insights for product development, user experience enhancements, and personalized marketing initiatives. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and advancements in marketing analytics, and provide recommendations for continuous improvement and innovation.
